problem.title: CheckPoint: Block on Spring
problem.script: #Enter the computations here m = random.randrange(75, 160, 5)/100 k = random.randrange(250, 400, 5) F = random.randrange(12, 20, 1) vmax = math.sqrt( k/ m)*( F/ k) Ft = F*math.sqrt(3)/2
problem.p: A block of mass m = $m kg is attached to a spring with a force constant k = $k N/m. The block is in simple harmonic motion. At the moment that the block has zero instantaneous speed, the magnitude of the force acting on it is F = $F Newtons.
What is the best concept to use in order to find the maximum speed of the block during the vibrations?

choicegroup.choice: Kinematics of Motion with Constant Acceleration

problem.p: Find the maximum speed of the block during the vibrations.
Find the magnitude of the force acting on the block at the moment when the speed is one-half of the maximum speed.
